questions.2: Complex and novel ideas excite you more than simple and straightforward ones.
questions.3: You usually feel more persuaded by what resonates emotionally with you than by factual arguments.
questions.4: Your living and working spaces are clean and organized.
questions.5: You usually stay calm, even under a lot of pressure.
questions.6: You find the idea of networking or promoting yourself to strangers very daunting.
questions.7: You prioritize and plan tasks effectively, often completing them well before the deadline.
questions.8: People’s stories and emotions speak louder to you than numbers or data.
questions.9: You like to use organizing tools like schedules and lists.
questions.10: Even a small mistake can cause you to doubt your overall abilities and knowledge.
questions.11: You feel comfortable just walking up to someone you find interesting and striking up a conversation.
questions.12: You are not too interested in discussions about various interpretations of creative works.
questions.13: You prioritize facts over people’s feelings when determining a course of action.
questions.14: You often allow the day to unfold without any schedule at all.
questions.15: You rarely worry about whether you make a good impression on people you meet.
questions.16: You enjoy participating in team-based activities.
questions.17: You enjoy experimenting with new and untested approaches.
questions.18: You prioritize being sensitive over being completely honest.
questions.19: You actively seek out new experiences and knowledge areas to explore.
questions.20: You are prone to worrying that things will take a turn for the worse.
questions.21: You enjoy solitary hobbies or activities more than group ones.
questions.22: You cannot imagine yourself writing fictional stories for a living.
questions.23: You favor efficiency in decisions, even if it means disregarding some emotional aspects.
questions.24: You prefer to do your chores before allowing yourself to relax.
questions.25: In disagreements, you prioritize proving your point over preserving the feelings of others.
questions.26: You usually wait for others to introduce themselves first at social gatherings.
questions.27: Your mood can change very quickly.
questions.28: You are not easily swayed by emotional arguments.
questions.29: You often end up doing things at the last possible moment.
questions.31: You usually prefer to be around others rather than on your own.
questions.32: You become bored or lose interest when the discussion gets highly theoretical.
questions.33: When facts and feelings conflict, you usually find yourself following your heart.
questions.34: You find it challenging to maintain a consistent work or study schedule.
questions.35: You rarely second-guess the choices that you have made.
questions.36: Your friends would describe you as lively and outgoing.
questions.37: You are drawn to various forms of creative expression, such as writing.
questions.38: You usually base your choices on objective facts rather than emotional impressions.
questions.39: You like to have a to-do list for each day.
questions.42: You enjoy exploring unfamiliar ideas and viewpoints.
questions.43: You can easily connect with people you have just met.
questions.44: If your plans are interrupted, your top priority is to get back on track as soon as possible.
questions.45: You are still bothered by mistakes that you made a long time ago.
questions.46: You are not too interested in discussing theories on what the world could look like in the future.
questions.47: Your emotions control you more than you control them.
questions.48: When making decisions, you focus more on how the affected people might feel than on what is most logical or efficient.
questions.49: Your personal work style is closer to spontaneous bursts of energy than organized and consistent efforts.
questions.50: When someone thinks highly of you, you wonder how long it will take them to feel disappointed in you.
questions.51: You would love a job that requires you to work alone most of the time.
questions.52: You believe that pondering abstract philosophical questions is a waste of time.
questions.53: You feel more drawn to busy, bustling atmospheres than to quiet, intimate places.
questions.54: If a decision feels right to you, you often act on it without needing further proof.
questions.56: You complete things methodically without skipping over any steps.
questions.57: You prefer tasks that require you to come up with creative solutions rather than follow concrete steps.
questions.58: You are more likely to rely on emotional intuition than logical reasoning when making a choice.
questions.60: You feel confident that things will work out for you.
